content.question: Based on the model of speciation presented, which of the following describes the most likely consequence to the populations over time?

choices.label: Hybrid individuals are less likely to pass their genetic information on to subsequent generations.
Hybrid individuals living together are physically unable to mate with each other.
Geographically isolated populations gradually acquire similar heritable traits.
Differences between hybrid individuals of a species disappear over time.

content.answer: Hybrid individuals are less likely to pass their genetic information on to subsequent generations.

skill.text: 2.C: Explain how biological models relate to larger principles, concepts, processes, systems, or theories.
